posts.cooked:
Our team is using a Limelight to track balls (red and blue cargo) based on the color and drive towards them for collection. We are working on the best steps to tune our pipelines quickly for when we get to competition. A feature that would be really helpful is the ability to record frames from the Limelight during a match and play them back into the pipeline afterwards. This would allow us to tune our values while the robot is in the pit and see where we were having the most tracking issues.

Has anyone ever recorded frames on the Limelight in this way? I’ve been theorizing that it might be possible with some custom OpenCV, but I’m still not sure how playback would work.

Thanks!

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked:
There is a snapshot feature.

https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/networktables_api.html#camera-controls

You could also use the wpilib data logger to log the NT entries if you want:

By default, no telemetry data is recorded (saved) on the robot. The DataLogManager class provides a convenient wrapper around the lower-level DataLog class for on-robot recording of telemetry data ...

link_counts.title: On-Robot Telemetry Recording Into Data Logs — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: How to use/access the limelight snapshots is described here: https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/software_change_log.html#id39

posts.name: Tom Line
posts.cooked:
Here is what we have done this year quite successfully.

We bought a lithium ion power brick that puts out 12V 6A.  It’s about the same size as the limelight.  Then we hook the limelight up to the brick, and ethernet it to the laptop.  Then we quite literally walk out to the field with just the camera and brick and laptop (going to velcro the brick and limelight to the lid of the laptop for ease of use) and walk around taking dozens of snap shots.

If they don’t want you on the field at that point in time, the field side officials usually have no problem with you just walking around outside of the field.  You can hold the limelight right at the edge of the field as you walk around and take the snapshots.

This way, you don’t need a robot, and you can do it quickly, and you don’t get in the officials or field setup folks’ way.  It takes us about 30 seconds (one “walk” all the way around) to generate 40 or 50 snapshots.

Once you tune your pipeline on that Limelight, download the config file and upload it to the limelight on your comp bot.

Here is the power brick we use:

Amazon.com: TalentCell Rechargeable 72W 100Wh 12V/8300mAh 9V/11000mAh 5V/20000mAh DC Output Lithium ion Battery Pack for LED Strip, CCTV Camera and More, Portable Li-ion Batteries with AC/DC Charger : Patio, Lawn & Garden

posts.name: Aaron Waller
posts.cooked:
I’ve been trying to implement the snapshot feature using a button to update the /limelight/snapshot NT variable. The Variables tab in the driver station can see the value change from 0 to 1, but the snapshots never appear under the source image drop down on the limelight web UI. Note, I can take a snapshot from the web UI with no issues. Labview code attached… image 2481×1006 1.87 MB

image 2481×1006 1.87 MB

image 2481×1006 1.87 MB

My team uses Java, not Labview, but to get snapshots working properly we had to set the NT variable to 1 and then back to 0 after a short pause every time we take a snapshot.

Additionally we have this in our Limelight’s periodic function:

Not sure how well this translates into Labview but hope it helps!

posts.name: Aaron Waller
posts.cooked:
We’re setting the “snapshot” var back to 0 in the false case of the code above, so as soon as the button is released it should be getting reset. And the “variables” tab in the dashboard confirms that this is happening as intended in the network tables. But the Limelight doesn’t seem to be detecting the NT variable changing.

All other functions seem to be working though. For example, we can change pipelines without issue when we are targeting. @Brandon_Hjelstrom any ideas?

posts.name: Aaron Waller
posts.cooked:
I’ve been trying to implement the snapshot feature using a button to update the /limelight/snapshot NT variable. The Variables tab in the driver station can see the value change from 0 to 1, but the snapshots never appear under the source image drop down on the limelight web UI. Note, I can take a snapshot from the web UI with no issues. Labview code attached…

For anyone following, it looks like the latest firmware 2022.2.3 (3/16/22) addresses a bug with the Limelight snapshot function. https://docs.limelightvision.io/en/latest/software_change_log.html#id1
